title: What's foreigners favorite Chinese songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: I recommend a Chinese song "dī dā" by Kan Kan.  If you've ever been to the Old Town in Lijiang (it's almost a requirement for China tourism), you'll remember its little winding streets. Part of that for many people is the song dī dā by the singer KanKan. It's a simple song, with just guitar, vocals and violins, but it's very pleasant to listen to. You'll know it if you've heard it - it has a distinctive onomatopoeia line that repeats throughout the song. As far as I know, Di Da has become a bit of a cliche. You go to Lijiang on a romantic holiday with your partner, hear Di Da everywhere (every shop plays it on repeat), and after that Di Da becomes your nostalgic song for that holiday. Seriously, it seems like vast numbers of people have had the same experience with this song. It's also worth remembering that whilst Lijiang is very nice, it's also maximised its tourism about as far as you can go. It's a bit like Venice. It is genuinely a nice place but you can't get away from the fact that it's making a lot of money, and everyone there knows it. Anyway, on with the song! dī dā lyrics translation Dídā dídā dídā dídā Shízhēn tā bù tíng zài zhuǎndòng  The hour hand, it never stops turning Dídā dídā dídā dídā Xiǎoyǔ tā pāidǎzhe shuǐhuā  Light rain, she patters and splashes Dídā dídā dídā dídā Shì bùshì hái huì qiānguà tā  Will I still worry about him? Dídā dídā dídā dídā Yǒu jǐ dī yǎnlèi yǐ luòxià  A few tears have already fallen Dídā dídā dídā dídā  Jìmò de yè hé shuí shuōhuà  In the lonely night, who can you talk to? Dídā dídā dídā dídā  Shāngxīn de lèi er shuí lái cā  Who will wipe away broken-hearted tears? Dídā dídā dídā dídā Zhěnglǐ hǎo xīnqíng zài chūfā  Compose your mood then set off Dídā dídā dídā dídā Hái huì yǒurén bǎ nǐ qiānguà  There are people who will worry about you  Hē hē! Hey...

My favorite Chinese songs are probably complete opposites, and TBH, very biased. I’ve heard a total of 6 Chinese songs- 4 by Z.Tao and 2 by Kris Wu. I know, right? Ex-EXO members. Pretty biased. Anyway, songs 1 & 2 are the slower and sweeter (song 1) Time Boils The Rain and (song 2) There is a Place (有一个地方) by Kris Wu. Time Boils The Rain  Favorite line: wǒmen shǒu lāshǒu yě chéng zhōu / huàguò bēishāng héliú - hand in hand we may form a boat / carrying us across the river of sadness[1] There is a Place (有一个地方)  Favorite line: wǒ xiǎngqǐ zuìchū nǐ múyàng xiǎngqǐ bānbó de shíguāng - I think back to my first sight of you, think back to those mottled times[2] Song 3 is the faster, more upbeat, polar opposite of songs 1 & 2, Black White (AB) by ZTAO. Black White (AB)  Favorite line: yǐwéi wánměi de jiéjú yǎnbiàn chéngle èmèng - the perfect ending turned into a nightmare[3] Anyway, as I am foreign, and these are my favorite, while very biased, Chinese songs, I believe I’ve answered your question!
